text.p: These are the headlines selected from Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Parizeau book stuns separatists: Bouchard, Duceppe deny knowledge of plan to declare independence unilaterally.
- Deficit fall faster than predicted: Drop should add fuel to election debate over taxes and spending.
- Doctor charged with murder: Critically ill patient died in Halifax intensive-care unit.
- Bre-X fraud was not hard to pull off.
- Swiss draw fire over Nazi plunder: Government reneged on agreement to return millions in assets, U.S. report says.
- Aids drugs show surprising success: Researchers are cautiously optimistic.
- How Bre-X samples were salted: Scam could easily have been done by one or two people, man who supervised testing says.
- TSE pulls the plug on shares: In other embarrassments, two directors quit and fraud complaints are filed.
- Ontario plans to strengthen OSC: Bill would convert regulator into self-funding agency.
- Bentall to launch stock sale to public: Property owner raising $103.4 million.
- Cameco eyes US$4B deal to buy Russian warheads: Canadian firm may join international venture to purchase immense quantities of uranium salvaged from nuclear weapons.
- Bre-X delisted by TSE as RCMP team begins fraud investigation.
